title: CSS Grid Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of CSS Grid layout system and properties

questions.question: Which property sets the number of columns in a grid?
questions.explanation: grid-template-columns — This defines the column structure of the grid container.

questions.question: How do you make an item span multiple columns?
questions.explanation: grid-column: span 2 — This allows the grid item to occupy multiple columns.

questions.question: Which property sets spacing between grid rows and columns?
questions.explanation: gap — The gap property controls spacing between both rows and columns in a grid.

questions.question: What does repeat(auto-fit, minmax(150px, 1fr)) do?
choices: Automatically creates as many columns as fit, each at least 150px wide, and distributes extra space evenly
Creates a single column with flexible height
questions.explanation: Automatically creates as many columns as fit, each at least 150px wide, and distributes extra space evenly — Perfect for responsive layouts.

questions.question: Why use display: grid instead of display: flex for a photo gallery?
choices: Grid handles both rows and columns simultaneously
questions.explanation: Grid handles both rows and columns simultaneously — This makes creating 2D layouts like galleries simpler than Flexbox, which is mostly 1D.
